title: Practice Challenge: Type a React Component
description:
Create a typed ProductCard component:

1. Define a Product interface with:
   - id: number
   - name: string
   - price: number
   - inStock: boolean

2. Define ProductCardProps interface with:
   - product: Product
   - onAddToCart: (id: number) => void

3. Create a simulated ProductCard that uses these types

4. Show how TypeScript catches errors
instructions: Define TypeScript interfaces and simulate a typed React component. Show error cases that TypeScript would catch.

hints.text: Define Product interface with all required properties
ProductCardProps needs product: Product and onAddToCart: (id: number) => void
Use optional properties (?) for non-required props

commonMistakes.correction: Define proper interfaces for all data structures
